intro: Spigelia olfersiana, commonly known as the redroot stokesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a woody stem with reddish-brown bark and is often found in moist, shaded woodlands. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Spigelia olfersiana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
